notesStmt.note: Four partbooks tenor, contra tenor, medius, bassus), each with a separate title page. Partbook 1 previously published as STC 6418.

Partbook 1 perhaps compiled by Thomas Caustun (Causton or Cawston), the only person credited in any way in STC 6418, which is included here. He and many other persons are given credit for the arrangements here. For evidence concerning the printing and further details of individual copies see "The British Library Journal", X (1984), pp. 1-31--STC.
The cancel title page of STC 6418 and quires N-T of the bassus and quires A-T of the 3 other partbooks were printed at this time--STC.
At the foot of the first title page (and subsequent title pages): Cum gratia & pruilegio regæ maiestatis.
At foot fo title page: Cum gratia & priuilegio Regiæ Maiestatis.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).

Full documentation of the original data capture process is available from the Text Creation Partnership web site. All versions of the texts are now archived and freely available for download. See the TCP Download FAQ for detailed information. The TEI P5 versions are also freely available from the TCP Github repository.

div.p: THE TENOR ✚ Mornyng and Euenyng prayer and Communion, set forthe in foure partes, to be song in churches, both for men and children, wyth dyuers other godly prayers & Anthems, of sundry mens doynges.
¶ Imprinted at London by Iohn Day, dwelling ouer Aldersgate, beneath Saint Martins.
¶ These bookes are to be sold, at hys shop vnderneath the gate.
¶ Cum gratia & priuilegio Regiae Maiestatis.

figure.figDesc: decorative border incorporating the Royal blazon and printer's device of John Day

figure.q: HONI SOIT QVI MAL Y PENCE

div.head: Tenor
Morning prayer.
This tenor is for men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
COme let vs sing vnto the Lord let vs hartely reioyce in the strength of our saluation let vs come before his presence with thankes geuing and shew our selues glad in him with psalmes. For the Lord is a great god and a great kinge aboue all gods in his handes are all the corners of the earth and the strength of the hils is his also. The sea is his and he made it and his handes prepared the dry land. O come let vs worship and fall downe and knele before the Lord our maker. For he is the Lord our god and we
〈♫〉 are the people of his pasture and the shepe of his handes. To day if ye wyl heare his voyce harden not your harts, as in the prouocatiō, and in the daye of temptacion in the wildernes when your fathers tempted me, proued me and saw my workes. Forty yeares long was I greued with this generation and sayd it is a people that do erre in theyr hartes, for they haue not knowne my wayes. Vnto whome I sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my rest. Glory be to the father and to the son and to the holy Ghost. As it was in the beginning is now and euer shalbe world without end. Amen.

div.head: ❧ Te deum laudamus.
This Contra tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
WE knowledge thee to be the Lord all the erth doth worship thee ye father euerlasting to the all aungels cry aloud the heauens and all the powers therin. To thee cherubin and Seraphin continually do cry: holy, holy, holy, Lord god of Sabaoth, Heauen and earth are ful of the maiesty of thy glory. ij the glorious cōpany of the Apostles prayse thee. The goodly felowship of the prophets prayse thee. The noble armie of Martirs prayse thee. The holy church through
〈♫〉 out all the world doth knowledge thee: The father of an infinite maiestye, thy honourable true and onely sonne, also the holye Ghoste the comforter, thou arte the kinge of Glorye, O Christe, thou arte the euerlastynge sonne of the father. When thou tookest vpon thee to delyuer manne, thou didst not abhorre the Virgins wombe, when thou hadst ouercome the sharpenes of death, thou diddest open the kyngdome of Heauen to all beleuers. Thou syttest on the ryghte hande of God in the glorye of the father, we beleue that thou shalte come to be our iudge: we therfore praye thee helpe thy
〈♫〉 seruauntes whome thou hast redemed with thy precious bloud▪ make them to be numbred wyth thy sayntes in glory euerlasting. O lord saue thy people▪ and blesse thine heritage gouerne them & lift them vp for euer. Day by day we magnify thee, and we worship thy name euer world without end. Vouchesafe O Lord to kepe vs this daye without sinne: O Lord haue mercy vpon vs, haue mercy vpon vs. O Lord let thy mercy be lightened vpō vs, as our trust is in thee. O Lord in thee haue I trusted, let me neuer be confounded, be confounded.

div.head: Benedictus.
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
BLessed be the Lord god of Israell for he hath visited and redemed his people & hath raised vp a mightye saluation for vs, in the house of hys seruaunte Dauid. As he spake by the mouth of hys holye Prophetes whyche hath bene since the world began. That we should be saued from our ennemies, and from the handes of al that hate vs. To performe the mercy promised to our fathers, and to remember his holy couenaunt. To performe the othe which he sware to our father Abraham, that he would geue vs. That we being deliuered out of the handes of our enemies
〈♫〉 might serue him without feare. In holines and rightwisenes before him al the dayes of my life. And thou childe shalt be called the Prophet of the highest, for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his wayes. To geue knowledge of saluation vnto his people, for the remission of theyr sinnes, through the tender mercy of our God whereby the day spring from an hye hath visited vs. To geue light to them that sit in darknes, and in the shadow of death, and to guide our feete into the way of peace. Glory be to the father, and to the sonne, and to the holy ghost. As it was in the beginning is now, and euer.
〈♫〉 shalbe world without end. Amen.

div.head: The Letany.
This Tenor is for Men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O God the father of heauen, haue mercy vpon vs miserable sinners. O God the sonne redemer of the world, haue mercy. &c. O God the holy ghost proceding from the father and the son. haue mercy. &c. O holy blessed and glorious Trinity thre parsons and one God haue mercy. &c. Spare vs good Lord. Good Lorde deliuer vs. We beseche thee to heare vs good Lorde. Son of God we besech thee to heare vs. Graunt vs thy peace. Haue
〈♫〉 mercy vpon vs, O Christ heare vs. Lord haue mercy vpon vs. Christ haue mercy vpon vs. Lord haue mercy vpon vs.

div.head: The lordes prayer
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
OVr father which art in heauen, halowed be thy name. Thy kingdome come. Thy will be done in earth as it is in heauen Geue vs this day our dayly bread. And forgeue vs our trespaces as we forgeue them that trespace agaynst vs and let vs not be led into temptation: but deliuer vs from euill. Amen.

div.head: The Communion.
This tenor is for men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd haue mercy vpon, vs and encline oure hartes to kepe this law. Lord haue mercy vpon vs: and write all these thy lawes in our harts we besech thee

div.head: The Crede
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
THe father almighty maker of heauen and earth and of all thinges visible and inuisible. And in one Lord Iesu Christ the onely begoten sonne of God begotten of his
〈♫〉 father before all worlds, God of God, light of lyght, very god of very God begotten not made being of one substance with the father, by whome al thynges were made: who for vs men and for our saluation came downe from heauen, and was incarnated by the holy ghost of the Virgin Mary and was made man, and wad crucefied also for vs vnder Poncius Pilate He suffred and was buried, and the third day he rose again according to the scriptures. And ascended into heauen into heuen, and sitteth at the right hand of the father. And he shall come agayne with glory to iudge both the quicke and the dead, whose
〈♫〉 kingdome shal haue no end, shal haue no end. And I beleue in the holy ghost the Lord and geuer of life, who procedeth from the father and the sonne together is worshipped and glorisied, who spake by the Prophets. And I beleue one Catholike and Apostolike Churche I acknowledge one baptisme for the remission of synnes, and I looke for the resurrection of the deade: And the life of the worlde to come. Amen.

div.head: A thankes geuing for the poore
This Tenor is for Men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
LEt your light so shine before men that they may see your
〈♫〉 good workes and glorify your father which is in heauen.

div.head: The Sanctus
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
HOly, holy, holy, Lord god of hostes. Holy, holy, holy, Lord God of hostes, holy, holy, holy Lord god of hostes: heauen and earth are ful of thy glory. ij ij Glory be to thee, O Lord most hye. ij ij ij ij

div.head: The Communion.
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
ANd in earth peace, good wil towards mē: we praise thee, we
〈♫〉 blesse thee, we worship thee, we glorify thee, we geue thankes to thee, for thy greate glory for thy greate glory. O Lord god heauenly king god the father almighty, O Lord the onely begotten sonne, Iesus Christ O Lord God lambe of God, sonne of the father: ij which sakest away the sins of the world haue mercy vpon vs. Thou that takest away the sinnes of the world, receiue our prayers. Thou that sittest at the right hand of God the father. ij haue mercy vpon vs. ij For thou onely art holy, thou onely art the Lord, thou onely O Christ with the holy ghost art most hygh in the
〈♫〉 glory of god the father, In the glory of god the father. Amen.

div.head: A Prayer.
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
REioyce in the Lord alwayes. And again I say reioyce let your softnes be known vnto al mē for the Lord is euen at hand, for the Lord is euen at hand, Be not carefull ij but in all thinges, ij let your peticion, and prayer: and supplication, with geuinge of thankes ij be knowne before god. And the peace of god whiche passeth all vnderstanding, all vnderstanding kepe your hartes and mindes. ij in Christ Iesu our
〈♫〉 Lord. Amen.

div.head: Euening Praier.
This tenor is for men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
MY soule doth magnify the Lorde and my sprite hath reioysed in god my sauior. For he hath regarded the lowlines of his handmayden. For behold from henceforth all generations shall cal me blessed. For he that is mighty hath magnified me, and holy is his name. And his mercy is on them that feare him throughout all generations. He hath shewed strength with his arme he hath scattered
〈♫〉 the proud in the imaginations of theyr hartes. He hath put downe the mighty from theyr seate, and hath exalted the humble and meeke He hath filled the hungry with good things and the riche he hath sent empty away. He remembring his mercy hath holpen his seruaunt Israel, as he promised to our fore fathers Abraham and hys seede for euer. Glory be to the father and to the sonne and to the holye ghoste. As it was in the beginninge is nowe and euer shalbe worlde without end. Amen.

div.head: Nunc dimittis
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd now lettest thou thy seruauntes depart in peace according to thy worde. For myne eyes haue sene thy saluation, which thou hast prepared before the face of all people To be a light to lighten the Gentils and to be the glory of thy people Israell. Glory be to the father and to the sonne, and to ye holy ghost. As it was in the beginning, and is now and euer shalbe world without end. Amen, Amen

div.head: An other Magnificat
This tenor is for men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
MY soule doth magnify the Lord and my sprite hath reioysed
〈♫〉 in God my sauiour. For he hath regarded the lowlines of his handmayden. For behold from hence forth all generations shall call me blessed. For he that is mighty hath magnified me, and holy is his name And his mercy is on them that feare him throughout all generations He hath shewed strength with his arme, he hath scattred the proud in the imaginations of their hartes. He hath put down the mighty from their seate, and hath exalted the humble and meke. He hath filled the hungry with good thinges and the rich he hath sent empty away. He remembringe hys mercye hath holpen hys seruaunte Israell,
〈♫〉 as he promised to our fathers Abraham and hys seede for euer. Glory be to the father and to the son, & to the holy Ghost. As it was in the beginning, is now, and euer shalbe, world without end. Amen.

div.head: ❧ Nunc dimittis.
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd now lettest thy seruauntes depart in peace according to thy worde. For myne eyes haue sene thy saluation, which thou hast prepared before the face of all people. To be a light to lighten the Gentils & to be the glory of thy people Israell. Glory be to ye father & to the son, & to ye holy ghost. As it was in the
〈♫〉 beginning, is now & euer shalbe world without end. Amen,

div.head: A godly prayer
This tenor is for Men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
LEt all the Congregation that is within this place cry vnto God that holy Lord, to sende vs of hys grace. Blessed be the Lorde our God, and blessed be hys name, now blessed be our sauior, that bought vs from all payne O Lord, now harken vnto vs, and graunt vs our request, we pray thee yt thou woldest vouchesafe to bring vs to thy rest: O most gracious sauior, thou art all only god: yu didst redeme vs wt thy deth wt sheding of thy blud. Now let
〈♫〉 vs through thy precious death be of thy holy elect for who that beleueth not of thee, shalbe from thee reiect, We sing prayses vnto our God with thankes vnto our Lord, because he hath so blessed vs, that we do know his word. Also Lord God, now guide vs so we may do thy will like those that most do loue the Lord in being faythfull stil, Our tonges shalbe our instrument, our hartes shall shew our voice, and all the powers within our brestes in God they shall reioyce. Graūt vs that we may kepe alwayes thy holy statutes tenne: preserue our Queene Elizabeth: all people say. Amen.

div.head: A morning prayer in foure partes.
This tenor is for children.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Come let vs sing vnto the Lord, let vs hartely reioyce in the strength of our saluation. Let vs come before his presence with thankes geuing, and shew our selfe glad in him with Psalmes. For the Lorde is a great God, and a great king aboue all gods. In his hande are al the corners of the earth, and the strength of the hils is his also. The sea is his & he made it, & his hands prepared the dry land. O come let vs worship & fall down and knele before the Lord our maker, for he is the Lord our God, and
〈♫〉 we are the people of his pasture and the sheepe of his handes. To day if ye will heare his voyce hardē not your hartes as in the prouocation and in the day of temptation in the wildernes, when your fathers tēpted me, proued me and saw my workes. Forty yeares long was I greaed with this generations, and sayd it is a people that do erre in their hartes, for they haue not known my wayes, vnto whome I sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my rest. Glory be to the father and to the sonne, and to the holy Ghost. As it was in the beginning is now and euer shalbe world without end. Amen

div.head: Te Deum laudamus
This tenor is for Men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
WE knowledge thee to be the Lord. All the earth doth woorship thee the father euerlasting. To thee al angels cry aloud, the heauens & all the powers therin. To thee Cherubin and Seraphin continually do cry. Holy, holy, holy. Lord god of Sabaoth. Heauen and earth are ful of the maiesty of thy glory. The glorious company of the Apostles prayse thee. The goodly felowship of the prophets prayse thee. The noble army of Martyrs prayse thee. The holy church
〈♫〉 thorow out all the world doth knowledge thee, the father of an infinite maiesty: Thy honorable true and onely sonne, Also the holy ghost the comforter. Thou art the king of glory, O Christ Thou art the euerlasting sonne of the father. When thou tokest vpon thee to deliuer man thou didst not abhorre the virgins wombe: When thou hadst ouercome the sharpenes of death, thou didst open the kingdome of heauen to all beleuers. Thou sittest on the right hand of god in the glory of the father, we beleue that thou shalt come to be our iudge. We therfore pray thee helpe thy seruaunts whome thou hast redemed
〈♫〉 with thy precious bloud. Make them to be numbred with thy saintes in glory euerlasting. O Lord saue thy people and blesse thine heritage. Gouerne them and lift them vp for euer. Day by day we magnifye thee. And we worship thy name euer world without end. Vouchsafe O Lord to kepe vs this day without sinne. O Lord haue mercy vpon vs, haue mercy vpon vs. O Lord let thy mercy lighten vpon vs, as our trust is in thee. O Lord in thee haue I trusted, let me neuer be confounded.

div.head: Benedictus.
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
FOr he hath visited and redemed his people and hathe lifted vppe an horne of saluation to vs in the house of his seruaunt Dauid. As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophetes which hath bene since the world began, that we should be saued from our enemies, and from the hands of al ye hate vs. To performe the mercy promised to our fathers, and to remember his holy couenaunte, to perfourme the othe whiche he sware to our fathers Abraham, that he woulde geue vs. That we being deliuered oute of the handes of our enemies mighte serue hym wythout
〈♫〉 feare. In holynes and ryghteousenes before hym all the dayes of our lyfe. And thou chylde shalte bee called the Prophette of the hyghest, for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways. To geue knowledge of saluation vnto his people for the remission of theyr sinnes. Through the tender mercy of our God, wherby the day spring from an high hath visited vs, to geue light to them that sit in darkenes and in the shadow of death, and to guide our fete into the way of peace. Glorye be to the father and to the sonne and to the holye ghoste As it was in the beginninge, is now, and euer shalbe world
〈♫〉 without end Amen.
div.byline: Heath Sing the Letany as it is before

div.head: The Communion.
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd haue mercy vpon vs: and enclyne our hartes to keepe thys lawe. Lorde haue mercye vppon vs: and write all these thy lawes in our hartes we beseche thee.

div.head: The Crede
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
THe father almighty maker of heauen and earth and of all thinges visible and inuisible. And in
〈♫〉 Lord Iesu Christ the onely begotten sonne of god begotten of his father before al worlds, god of god, light of light, very god of very god. begottē not made, being of one substance with the father: by whom al things were made, who for vs men and for our saluation came downe from heauen, and was incarnate by the holy ghost of the virgine Mary and was made man, and was crucified also for vs vnder Pontius Pilate he suffred, and was buried and the third day he rose againe according to the scriptures, and ascended into heauen: and sitteth at the right hand of the father, and he shal come againe with glory to iudge
〈♫〉 both the quicke and the dead, and I beleue in the holy ghost, the Lord and geuer of life. Who procedeth from the father and the sonne, who with the father & the son together is worshipped & glorified, who spake by the Prophets. And I beleue one catholike & Apostolik church, I acknowledge one Baptisme for the remission of sinnes: and I looke for the resurrection of the dead, and the life of the world to come. Amen.

div.head: A thankes geuing for the poore
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
LAy not vp for your selues treasure vpon the earth where the rust and moth doth corrupt, and where theues breake through and
〈♫〉 steale. But lay vp for your selues treasure in heauen, where neither ruste nor mothe doth corrupte, and where theeues doo not breake through nor steale.

div.head: The Sanctus
This Tenor is for Men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
HOly, holy, holy, Lord God of hostes, heauen and earth are ful of thy glory, glory be to thee, O Lord most hygh: Glory be to thee O Lord, most high

div.head: The Communion.
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
ANd in earth peace good will towardes men, we praise thee
〈♫〉 we blesse thee, we worship thee, we glorify thee, we geue thanks to thee for thy great glory. O Lord god heauēly king, God the father almighty. Lord the onely begotten sonne Iesu Christ, O Lord god lambe of god son of the father, that takest away the sinnes of the world, haue mercy vpon vs thou that takst away the sinnes of the worlde, receiue our prayer: thou that sittest at the right hand of god the father, haue mercy vpon vs. For thou onely art holy, thou onely art the Lord, thou onely O Christe, with the holy ghost art most high in the glory of god the • ther. Amen.

div.head: A godly prayer
This tenor is for Men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
PRaise we the Lorde at all times, at all times. Prayse we the Lord at al times, at all tymes. Let our mouthes saye wel by the Lorde, at all tymes, at all tymes. That our soules maye be reioysed by the Lorde, at all tymes, at all tymes. Meeke menne shall heare and reioyce in the Lord, at all tymes, at all tymes, at all tymes.

div.head: Euening Praier.
This tenor is for men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
MAnd my sprite hath reioysed in God my sauiour. For he hath regarded the lowlines of hys handemayden. For beholde from hencefoorth all generations shall call me blessed For he that is mightye hath magnified me, and holye is hys name And hys mercye is on them that feare hym throughoute all generations. He hath shewed strength wyth hys arme he hath scattered the proude in the imaginacion of theyr harts. He hath put downe the mighty from theyr seate, and hath exalted the humble and meeke.
〈♫〉 He hath filled the hungry with good things and the riche he hath sente empty away. He remembring his mercy hath holpē his seruaunt Israel, as he promised to our father Abrahā & his seede for euer: Glory be to the father & to the sonne & to the holy ghost. As it was in the beginning and is now & euer shalbe world with out end. Amē.

div.head: Nunc dimittis
This tenor is for men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd now lettest thou thy seruaunt depart in peace according to thy promise▪ For myne eyes hath sene the sauior: whome thou hast prepared before all people. A light for the
〈♫〉 lightening of the heathen, and for the prayse of the people of Israell. Glory be to the father and to the sonne and to the holye ghoste. As it was in the beginning as it is now and euer shalbe. Amen.

div.head: Another Magnificat
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
MY soule doth magnify the Lorde and my sprite reioysed in god my sauiour. For he hath regarded the lowlines of his handmayden. For behold from henceforth all generations shall cal me blessed. For he that is mighty hath magnified me, and holy is his
〈♫〉 name, and holy is his name. And his mercy is on them that feare him throughout all generations. He hath shewed strength wyth hys arme he hath scattered the proude in the imaginacion of theyr harts of their hartes He hath put downe the mighty, he hath put downe the mighty from theyr seate, and hath exalted the humble and meeke the humble and meeke. He hath filled the hungry with good things wyth good thinges and the riche he hath sente empty away. He remembringe hys mercy hath holpen his seruaunt Israel, hath holpen his seruant Israel, as he promised, as he promised to our father Abraham
〈♫〉 to our father Abraham and his sede for euer, and his sede for euer. Glory be to the father and to the sonne and to the holy ghost. As it was in the beginning is now and euer shalbe and euer shalbe world without ende. Amen.

div.head: Nunc dimittis
This Tenor is for Men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd now lettest thou thy seruaunt depart in peace according to thy woord, according to thy woord. For mine eyes haue sene thy saluation, thy saluation: which thou hast prepared before the face of all thy people. To be a light to lighten the Gentils, and to be the glory
〈♫〉 of thy people Israel, of thy people Israel, Glory be to the father and to the sonne and to the holy ghost. As it was in the beginning, is now and euer shalbe ij world without end. Amē.

div.head: Venite exultemus.
This morning prayer is for chidren.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Come let vs sing vnto the Lorde, lette vs hartely reioyce in the strength of our saluation Let vs come before his presence with thankesgeuing, and shewe ourselues glad in him with Psalmes. For the Lord is a great God and a great kinge aboue all gods. In his hands are all the corners of
〈♫〉 the earth are al the corners of the earth. And the strength of the hils is his also. The sea is his and he made it and his hands prepared the dry lande. O come let vs worship and fal down ij and knele before the Lord our maker. ij for he is the Lord our God. ij And we are the people of his pasture ij and the shepe of his handes. To day if ye will heare his voyce harden not your hartes as in the prouocation and in the day of temptation in the wildernes, when your fathers tempted me, proued me and saw my workes. ij Forty yeares long was I greued
〈♫〉 with this generations, and sayd it is a people that do erre in their hartes, for they haue not known my wayes, vnto whom I sware in my wrath, I sware in my wrath ij yt they should not enter into my rest. Glory be to the father and to the sonne, and to the holy Ghost As it was in the beginning is now and euer shalbe world without end. ij Amen.

div.head: Te Deum laudamus
This tenor is for Men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
WE knowledge thee to be the Lord. All the earth doth worship thee which arte the father euerlastynge. To thee al aungels cry
〈♫〉 aloude, the heauens and all the powers therein. To thee Cherubin and Seraphin continually do cry. Holy, holy, Lord god of Sabaoth ij Heauen and earth are ful of the maiesty of thy glory. The glorious company of the Apostles prayse thee. The goodlye fellowship of the Prophetes prayse thee. The noble armye of Martyrs prayse thee. The holy Churche throughe all the worlde doth knowledge thee. The father of an infinite maiestye. Thy honourable true and onely sonne. Also the holy ghost the comforter, thou art the king of glory O Christ, thou art the euerlasting son of the father
〈♫〉 of the father. When thou tookest vpon thee to deliuer man, thou didst not abhorre the virgins wōbe: whā yu hadst ouercome the sharpnes of death, thou didst open the kyngdome of heauen to all beleuers. Thou sittest at ye right hand of God in ye glory of the father ij:

〈♫〉 We beleue that yu shalt come to be our iudge. We therfore pray thee helpe thy seruantes whom thou hast redemed wt thy precious bloud. Make them to be numbred wyth thy sayntes in glory euerlastyng. O Lorde saue thy people, and blesse thyne heritage ij gouerne thē & lift them vp for euer. ij Day by day we
〈♫〉 magnify thee and we worship thy name euer world without end. Vouchsafe, O Lord to kepe vs this day with out sinne, O Lord haue mercye vpon vs, haue mercy vpon vs, O Lord let thy mercy lighten vpon vs, as our truste is in thee. O Lord in thee haue I trusted, let me neuer be confounded. ij

div.head: Benedictus.
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
BLessed be the Lorde God of Israell, for he hath visited and redemed his people: And hath raysed vp a mighty saluation for vs, in the house of his seruaunt
〈♫〉 Dauid. As he spake by the mouth of his holy Prophetes, which hathe bene since the world began: That we should be saued from our enemies, and from the handes of all that hate vs. To performe the mercy promised to our fathers, to our fathers, and to remember hys holy couenaunt ij To performe the othe which he sware to our father Abraham that he would geue vs ij That we beyng deliuered deliuered out of the handes of our enemies, ij myght serue hym wythout feare, in holines and righteousnes before hym: in holines and righteousnes before hym ij all the dayes of our lyfe. And
〈♫〉 thou chyld shalt be called the prophet of the highest, for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord, of the Lord, to prepare his wayes. To geue knowledge of saluation vnto his people, for the remission of their sinnes Through the tender mercy of our God, wherby the day spring from an high ij hath visited vs. To geue light to them that sit in darknes, and in the shadow of death, and to guide our feete into the way of peace and to guide our fete into the way of peace. Glory be to the father and to the sonne, and to the holy ghost: As it was in the beginning and is now and euer shalbe, world without end, Amen.

div.head: The Communion.
This Tenor is for children.
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd haue mercy vpon vs, and enclyne our hartes to kepe this law. Lord haue mercy vpon vs, and write al these thy lawes in our hartes we besech thee

div.head: The Communion.
This Tenor part is for children
div.p:
〈♫〉
THe father almighty, maker of heauen and earth, and of all thyngs visible and inuisible: and in one Lord Iesu Christ, the onely begotten son of god, begotten
〈♫〉 of hys father before al worldes: God of god, lyght of lyght very God of very God, begotten not made, beyng of one substaunce wyth the father, by whom al thyngs were made: who for vs men and for our saluation came down from heauen, and was incarnate by the holy ghost of the virgin Mary, and was made man. And was crucified also for vs vnder Pontius Pilate: He suffred and was buried, and the third day he rose agayne accordyng to the scriptures. And ascended into heauen, and sitteth at the right hand of God the father: and he shal come agayne wyth glory to iudge both the quick and the dead,
〈♫〉 whose kingdome shal haue no end. And I beleue in the holy ghost, the Lord and geuer of life, who procedeth from the father and the son, who with the father and the son, together is worshipped and glorifyed, who spake by the prophets. And I beleue one catholike and Apostolike church. I acknowledge one baptisme for the remission of sins and I looke for the resurrection of the deade and the life of the worlde to come. Amen.

div.head: The Sanctus
This tenor is for children.
div.p:
〈♫〉
HOly, holy, holy, Lord God of hostes, heauen and earth are
〈♫〉 ful of thy glory, glory be to thee O Lord most high, glory▪ be to thee O Lord most hygh.

div.head: The Communion.
This tenor is for children.
div.p:
〈♫〉
ANd in earth peace, good wil towardes men, we prayse thee, we blesse thee, we worshippe thee, we glorify thee: we geue thanks to thee, for thy great glory. O Lord God, heauenly kyng God the father almighty: O lord ye onely begotten son Iesu Christ, O Lord God, lamb of God, son of ye father, that takest away the syns of the world, haue mercy vpō vs, thou that
〈♫〉 takest away ye sins of ye world, haue mercy vpō vs: thou ye takest away the sins of ye world, receyue our prayer: Thou yt sitst at ye right hand of God the father ij haue mercy vpon vs, haue mercy vpon vs: for thou onely art holy, art holy, art holy, yu only art ye Lord: ij yu only O Christ wt the holy ghost art most high, in the glory of God the father. Amen.

div.head: Euening Praier.
This tenor is for children
div.p:
〈♫〉
MY soule doth magnify the Lorde, and my spirite reioysed in God my sauiour. For he hath regarded the lowlines
〈♫〉 of his handmaidē. For behold frō henceforth al generations shal cal me blessed▪ For he that is mightye hath magnified me, & holy is hys name And hys mercye is on them that feare hym throughoute all generations. He hath shewed strength wyth hys arme, ij he hath scattered the proud in theimaginacion of theyr harts. He hath put down he hath put down ij the mighty from theyr seat, & hath exalted the humble & meeke. He hath filled the hungry with good things & the rich he hath sent empty away. He remēbring his mercy hath holpē his seruant Israell. As he promised to our father Abraham
〈♫〉 and to his seede for euer, ij & to his seede for euer. Glory be to the father and to the sonne and to the holy ghost. As it was in the beginning is now and euer shalbe world wythout end, world without end. Amen.

div.head: Nunc dimittis
This tenor is for children.
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd now let thy seruant depart in peace according to thy word: for mine eyes haue sene, ij thy saluation. Which thou hast prepared before the face of al people. To be a light to lighten
〈♫〉 the Gentils, and to be the glory, & to be the glory of thy people Israel. Glory be to the father and to the sonne and to the holy ghost: As it was in the beginning is now and euer shalbe world without end, world without end. Amen.

div.head: A prayer
This tenor is for children
div.p:
〈♫〉
RElieue vs O Lord that are weak and feble. ij and shew thy greate mercy, and shew thy great mercy vnto thy poore people. Turne thou our harts O Lord ij & we shal turned be, regard our sighes & sobs, which frō
〈♫〉 our hartes do flow, forget our former crimes. ij yt we may cleaue to thee that we may cleaue to thee, and worke in thy vineyard where vertues al do grow, ij do thys for vs O Lord, that are weake and feable and shewe thy greate mercye vnto thy poore people ij greate is thy pitye Lorde thoughe dayelye wee offende. ij And stayest thy wrathefull hande, and amids thyne yre, on mercy stil thou thinkest. ij O Lord we wil amend, forgeue and spare vs now, and as we do deserue Relieue thou vs O Lord that are weake and feeble. ij
〈♫〉
ij And shew to vs thy great mercye: ij and shewe thy great mercy vnto thy poore people Releue thou vs, O Lord, that are weake and feble, ij and shewe thy mercye to thy people. Relieue thou vs O Lorde that are weake and feeble, and shew thy great mercy vnto thy poore people, shew mercy to thy people. Amen

div.head: A prayer
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
HEare the voyce and prayer of thy seruauntes, of thy seruaunts, that they make before thee
〈♫〉 thys day that mine eyes may be open toward this house, night and day ij euer towardes this place, ij of which thou hast said my name shalbe there, and when thou hearest haue mercy on them, and when thou hearest haue mercy on them. ij ij

div.head: A prayer.
This tenor is for children.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Eternall God almighty, iust and holy, whose name is the Lord God of hostes, to thee O lord we cal & cry for mercy, for mercy: to thee O Lord we cal & cry for mercy, for mercy: for mercy: against thee we haue offēded, we & our fathers haue
〈♫〉 sinned, we haue done vniustly, we haue cōmitted iniquitie, now graūt to vs O Lord thy great mercy, now graunt to vs O Lord thy great mercy, for great is our miserie, great is our miserie, great is our miserie. Saue thy people O Lord and blesse thine own inheritaunce, despyse not the workes of thine own hands, because we be sinfull, thou shalt be called mercifull, because we be sinful, thou shalt be called merciful, because we be sinfull, thou shalt be called mercifull, forgeue vs now for the glory of thy holy name, forgeue vs now for the glory of thy holy name, that we may know thou art more mercifull then we deserue.
〈♫〉 We shall geue thankes to thee O Lorde, and reioyce in thy laude and prayse for euermore: We shall geue thankes to thee O Lord, and reioyce in thy laude and prayse, in thy laude and prayse, for euermore, for euermore. Amen.

div.head: A prayer.
This tenor is for children.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Lord in thee is al my trust, geue eare vnto my wofull cryes: refuse me not that am vniust, but bowing down thy heauenly eyes. Behold how I do stil lament, my sinnes wherin I thee offēd: O Lord for thē shall I be shent, sith thee
〈♫〉 to please I do entend. No no not so, thy wil is bent, to deale with sinners in thine yre: But when in hart they shal repent, thou grauntst with spede their iust desire. To thee therfore still shal I cry. To wash awaye my sinful crime. Thy bloud O Lord is not yet dry, but that it may helpe me in time. Hast nowe O Lord, hast now I say, to poure on me the gifts of grace, that when this life must flit away, in heauen with thee I may haue place, where thou dost raigne eternaly, wyth god whych once did downe thee send: where aungels sing continually to thee be prayse world without end. Amen.

div.head: The Anthem.
This Tenor part is for children
div.p:
〈♫〉
REmember not O Lord God our old iniquities, but let thy mercy spedely preuent vs, for we be very miserable, ij ij helpe vs God our sauiour. ij and for the glory of thy name deliuer vs. Be mercy ful and forgeue our synnes for thy names sake, ii Be mercifull and forgeue our sinnes for thy names sake, let not the wycked people saye ij where is their God, ij we be thy people and the shepe of thy pasture, we shal geue thankes vnto thee for euer. ij
〈♫〉
ij from age to age we shal set forth thy laude and prayse. To thee be honour and glorye, ij worlde without end. ij To the be honour and glorye world without end. ij Amen.

div.head: A Prayer.
This Tenor part is for Men S
div.p:
〈♫〉
I Geue you a new commaundement, that ye loue one another euen as I haue loued you. ij ij By this all men shall know yt ye are my Disciples, ij if ye loue one another, ij
〈♫〉 euen as I haue loued you. ij ij ij By

〈♫〉
YF ye loue me kepe my cōmaundements: And I wil pray the father, & he shal geue you another comforter, that he may byde with you for euer, ij euen ye sprite of truth, the sprite of truth, euen the sprite of truth, the sprite of truth, the sprite of truth. that

div.head: The Anthem
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
PRayse we the father, the son and the holy ghost: ij we magnify hym, we glorify hym, and superexalt
〈♫〉 hym, world without end, and superexalt hym ij for most prayse worthy art thou O Lord ij most glorious most worthy, most worthy, to he superexalted, to be superexalted to be superexalted for euer, and euer. for

div.head: The Anthem.
This Tenor is for children.
div.p:
〈♫〉
PRayse the Lord O our soules, and all that is within vs, prayse his holy name, prayse the Lord O our soules, & forget not al his benefites. The Lord is ful of compassion & mercy, long suffering & ful of great goodnes.

div.head: A prayer
This tenor is for children
div.p:
〈♫〉
SVbmit your selues one to another, in the feare of God speaking vnto your selues in psalmes and hymnes, and spiritual songs, and spiritual songs, singing & making melody to the Lord, and making melody to the Lord with your harts, geuing thanks always for althings ij vnto God the father almighty. In the name of our Lord Iesus Christ. ij Iesus Christ, of our Lord Iesus Christ. Singing

div.head: The Anthem.
This tenor is for Men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
SHew vs O Lord the light of thy coūtenance ye we being deliuered deliuered from the darkenes of our harts may come to the very light. ij which is Christ. And thou Lord preserue vs. ij while we be waking. ij And kepe vs while we be sleping, that we may wake with Christ, wake with Christ. And take rest in peace. And thou

div.head: A prayer.
This Tenor is for Men.
div.p:
〈♫〉
REioyce in the Lord alwayes, & againe I say reioyce, let your
〈♫〉 softnes, be known vnto al men, for the lord is euen at hand ij be not careful ij▪ But in all things ij let your peticions & prayer & supplicatiō wt geuing of thanks. ij be known before god. And the peace of god which passeth all vnderstanding, al vnderstanding, kepe your harts and minds ij. In Christ Iesu our Lord. Amen.

div.head: A prayer
This tenor is for Men
div.p:
〈♫〉
I Geue you a new commaundement, that ye loue one another, that ye loue one another, euen as I haue loued you, euen as I haue loued you. By this al men
〈♫〉 shal know that ye are my disciples, if ye loue one ano+ther, if ye loue one another euen as I haue loued you, euen as I haue loued you, By this al men shal knowe that ye are my disciples, if ye loue one another, if ye loue one another, euen as I haue loued you, euen as I haue loued you, euen as I haue loued you.

div.head: Exaudîat te Dominus
This tenor is for children
div.p:
〈♫〉
IN trouble & aduersity, in trouble and aduersity the Lord wil heare the Lord wil here thee still, wil heare thee stil, the maiestie
〈♫〉 of Iacobs God, the maiestie of Iacobs of Iacobs God, wil thee defend from ill, will thee defend from ill, will thee defend, will thee defend from ill, and send thee frō hys holy place, his helpe at euery nede, hys helpe at euery nede, and so in Sion, & so in Sion, and so in Sion stablishe thee and make thee strong in dede, in dede, and make thee strong in dede, and make thee strong in deede.

div.head: A prayer
This tenor is for children
div.p:
〈♫〉
MOst blessed Lord Iesu graunt me thy grace alway & with me worke vnto thend: And that I may euer desire, & wil that is most
〈♫〉 pleasaunt and acceptable vnto thee, thy will be my wil, and my wil alway to follow thy will. Be there alway in me one wil in me one wil and one desire with thee, so that I may haue no power to wil but euen as thou wilt graunt me aboue al things aboue al things that can be desired, that can be desired, ij for thou Lord art the very peace of the hart, and the perfect rest of body and soule both of body and soule for thou Lord art the very peace of the harte and the perfect rest of body and soul for euermore.

div.head: A Prayer.
This Tenor part is for children
div.p:
〈♫〉
TVrn thou vs O good Lord ij & so shal we be turned be fauourable O good lord be fauorable to thy people which turne to thee in weping fasting and praying for thou art a merciful god ij ful of cōpassiō lōg suffering ij long suffering and of great pity Spare thy people good lord ij & let not thyne heritage be brought to confusiō. Hear vs good lord for thy mercy is great ij & after the multitude of thy mercies looke vpon vs.

div.trailer: Here endeth the tenor in foure parts

❧ CONTRA TENOR.
✚ Mornyng and Euenyng prayer and Communion, set forthe in foure partes, to be song in churches, both for men and children, wyth dyuers other godly prayers & Anthems, of sundry mens doynges.
¶ Imprinted at London by Iohn Day, dwelling ouer Aldersgate, beneath Saint Martins.
¶ These bookes are to be sold, at hys shop vnderneath the gate.
¶ Cum gratia & priuilegio Regiae Maiestatis.
